Title: Pro-ISIS Hackers Compromise U.S. CENTCOM Twitter, YouTube Accounts
Intro: Hackers supporting Islamic State jihadists hacked the Twitter and YouTube accounts of the U.S. Central Command (CENTCOM), the Department of Defense confirmed Monday.  [Read More]

Title: Backdoored Phishing Templates Advertised on YouTube
Intro: Scammers are abusing YouTube as a new way to promote backdoored phishing templates and provide potential buyers with information on how to use the nefarious software, Proofpoint researchers warn.  [Read More]

Title: Malicious YouTube Pages Targeting Chrome Users
Intro: Researchers at Zscaler have discovered a fake YouTube page that is hosting malicious Chrome extensions. Such pages, as seen in the past, prey on the uninformed users with poorly patched systems to spread malware.  [Read More]

Title: Vengeful YouTube Video Leads to Prison Sentence for Philadelphia Man
Intro: Philadelphia Man Sentenced for Threatening U.S. Congressman via YouTube Video  [Read More]

Title: Behind Bars: The Hospital Guard Hacker Who Posted His Crime on YouTube
Intro: Jesse William McGraw, a former contract security guard at the North Central Medical Plaza in Dallas, who admitted hacking into that hospital’s computer systems, was recently sentenced to 110 months in Federal prison.  [Read More]

Title: White House Asked YouTube to Review Anti-Muslim Video
Intro:
The White House said Friday it had contacted video sharing website YouTube to ask for a review of an anti-Muslim
movie "Innocence of Muslims" that sparked riots and attacks on US diplomatic posts in the Arab World.  [Read More]

Title: Just Watching a YouTube Video Can Compromise Your Smartphone
Intro: Attackers can broadcast hidden voice commands from a loudspeaker at an event or to embed them in a trending YouTube video to compromise mobile devices.  [Read More]

Title: XSS Flaw in YouTube Gaming Earns Researcher $3,000
Intro: Google has awarded a researcher $3,133.7 for finding an XSS vulnerability in YouTube Gaming.  [Read More]

Title: Google Rewards Researchers for YouTube Comment Theft Vulnerability
Intro: YouTube vulnerability allowed users to copy any comment to their own video or channel. Google patched the bug and rewarded the researchers who found it.  [Read More]

Title: YouTube Flaw Allowed Removal of Any Video: Researcher
Intro: Logical flaw could have been exploited to delete any YouTube video. Google patched the bug and awarded $5,000 to the researcher who found it.  [Read More]
